contest-event.event-date: Sept. 23, 1922 D National Championship of Great Britain (Crystal Palace) National Championship of Great Britain (Championship Section Final) 1 Test Piece Contest National Championship of Great Britain (Finals) national-finals-championship-section European Championships The current Nationals contest began in 1900, but there was a previous 'Nationals' contest run 40 years earlier: Enderby Jackson's Great National Contest. Championship Freedom (Brass Band Symphony No. 1) Crystal Palace (Concert Hall), Crystal Palace Park, Sydenham, County of London, England, UK The reserve adjudicator was J.H. Carter. Prizes: 1st: 100 Pounds plus the 1000 Guinea Trophy 2nd: 50 Pounds plus the Daily Telegraph Challenge Cup 3rd: 30 Pounds 4th: 20 Pounds 5th: 15 Pounds 6th: Brass instrument valued at 25 Guineas 7th: Brass instrument valued at 20 Guineas 8th: Silver plated cornet valued at 18 Guineas 9th: Music stands valued at 7 Guineas May 13, 2010, 11:14 a.m. Aug. 28, 2013, 1:36 p.m. 1 Horwich RMI J. A.
